titlePart.text: SECTION B PERFORMING OPERATIONS
TRANSPORTING
PRINTING
PRINTING
LINING MACHINES
TYPEWRITERS
STAMPS
APPARATUS OR DEVICES FOR MANIFOLDING, DUPLICATING, OR PRINTING FOR OFFICE OR OTHER COM- MERCIAL PURPOSES
ADDRESSING MACHINES OR LIKE SERIES-PRINTING MACHINES
titlePart.entryReference: printing presses or machines for industrial purposes
handling sheets or webs in general

noteParagraph.text: The term "manifolding" is to be interpreted as meaning the obtaining of several copies simultaneously by means of pressure- sensitive layers when making an original.
The term "duplicating" is to be interpreted as meaning the obtaining of successive copies from a master, e.g. a hectographic image.
"Stencilling" involves the use of a printing surface which is perforated to form the image, the ink flowing through the perforations on the copy material.

As indicated by the references, groups and are intended to cover letterpress and lithographic printing apparatus only in so far as it is specially adapted for office or other commercial purposes, the general constructions or features of apparatus of these types being classified primarily in sub-class . Constructions or features determining classification in these groups are, for example: ease of operation by clerical staff, cleanliness of operation in non-industrial environments, the use of printing surfaces constructed for the production of a limited number of copies.

Constituent parts common to manifolding by means of pressure-sensitive layers or intermediaries, to apparatus or machines for duplicating or printing for office or other commercial purposes, and to addressing machines or like series-printing machines .

titlePart.text: Manifolding by means of pressure-sensitive layers or intermediaries
